result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger J Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court does not object to transfer to Winnebago Count if accepted.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drugs/drug paraphernalia.  Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel in Waukesha County within 6 months.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
